DOC.brief_summary: A two-phase , school-based intervention conduct high school Baltimore evaluate whether addition spice herbs vegetable dish National School Lunch Program ( NSLP ) increase vegetable intake among student urban predominantly African-American high school .
DOC.brief_title: Using Spices Herbs Increase Vegetable Intake Among Urban High School Students
DOC.detailed_description: The propose research conduct Cristo Rey Jesuit High School Baltimore , Maryland . In two-phase intervention , research team work Phase I stakeholder throughout high school community identify barrier vegetable intake NSLP student population determine spice herb might help overcome barrier . The stakeholder collaborate include student , school administration , cafeteria staff . Phase II focus direct measurement vegetable intake among student spice herbs add vegetable NSLP . The spiced vegetable recipe receive favorable student ranking taste test Phase I offer . The vegetable recipe flavor spice herbs meet NSLP requirement fat , sugar , total calorie , guideline . Student vegetable intake assess two outcome : 1 . ) plate waste , 2 . ) production waste .
DOC.criteria: Enrolled student Cristo Rey High School Able read write English ( exclusive Phase 1 participant ) Does eat lunch Cristo Rey High School cafeteria Not willing complete questionnaire ( exclusive Phase 1 participant )
